elements.name: childHasNominee
elements.title: Is there someone who helps {panel.childName} manage their money and legal decisions?
elements.description: This person would be considered {panel.childName}'s `Nominee`. If {panel.childName}'s Nominee is not alive anymore, select "NO".

elements.name: childHasNomineeNoExplanation
elements.title:
Because {panel.childName} is not `mentally competent`, but they do not have a `nominee`, you need to let {panel.childName} know directly that you are applying for a `Representation Grant`.

This service will tell you how to let them know in a later step.

elements.name: childNomineeName
elements.title: What is the name of the person who helps {panel.childName} manage their money and legal decisions?
elements.description: This name should be written using the Roman alphabet. English and French are examples of languages that use the Roman alphabet.

elements.name: childNomineeFormal
elements.title: Was {panel.childNomineeName} formally appointed to help {panel.childName} manage their money and legal decisions?
elements.description:
These are the ways someone can be formally appointed.
  • {panel.childName} could have signed a document that gave someone else the power of attorney using the Power of Attorney Act,
  • {panel.childName} could have signed a document that appointed someone as a representative using the Representation Agreement Act, or
  • a person can be appointed by the Court using the Patients Property Act,
  • a person could have been appointed either the Minister of Aboriginal Affairs and Northern Development or by the Court using the Indian Act

elements.name: childNomineeFormalYesExplanation
elements.title:
The Public Guardian and Trustee (PGT) will need a copy of the legal document that proves that {panel.childNomineeName} was formally appointed as {panel.childName}'s `nominee`.

You can get a head start by asking {panel.childNomineeName} for that document now, or, you can wait for this service to remind you in a later step.

For now, please continue answering questions about {panel.childNomineeName}.

elements.name: childNomineeFormalNoExplanation
elements.title:
Even if {panel.childNomineeName} was not formally appointed to help {panel.childName}, it is still best to let both {panel.childNomineeName} and {panel.childName} know that you are applying for a `Representation Grant`.

This service will tell you how to let them know in a later step.

For now, please continue answering questions about {panel.childNomineeName}.

elements.name: childDiedAfter
elements.title: Did {panel.childName} die after {deceasedDateOfDeathPlus4}?

elements.name: childDiedAfterFAQ1
elements.title: Why does this date matter?
elements.body:
Under the law, in order for {panel.childName} to qualify for {deceasedName}'s `assets`, {panel.childName} must have lived for at least 5 days after {deceasedName} died. Once {panel.childName} has qualified, it doesn't matter if {panel.childName} is now dead.

The people managing {panel.childName}'s belongings need to know that you are applying for a `Representation Grant` for {deceasedName}.

For more information, click here for the Five-day survival rule from the Wills, Estate and Succession Act (WESA). (This link opens in a new tab)

elements.name: childDiedAfterNoGchildExists
elements.title: Did {panel.childName} have any children?

elements.name: childDiedAfterNoGchildExistsFAQ1
elements.title: Do I include {panel.childName}'s legally adopted children?
elements.body:
Yes, you must include {panel.childName}'s legally adopted children. All of {panel.childName}'s biological and legally adopted children need to know that you are apply for a `Representation Grant`.

If you are not sure if a person was legally adopted by {panel.childName} or not, it is safer for you to include this person. You want as much transparency in your application as possible in case this person was legally adopted by {panel.childName}.

Even though you are telling this person you are applying for a Representation Grant, they don't automatically get part of {panel.childName}'s `estate`.

elements.name: childDiedAfterNoGchildExistsFAQ2
elements.title: Do I include {panel.childName}'s step-children?
elements.body:
No, you do not need to include {panel.childName}'s step-children because {panel.childName} did not legally adopt them. Only {panel.childName}'s biological or legally adopted children need to know that you are apply for a `Representation Grant`.

If you are not sure if a person was legally adopted by {panel.childName} or not, it is safer for you to include this person. You want as much transparency in your application as possible in case this personal was legally adopted by {panel.childName}.

Even though you are telling this person you are applying for a Representation Grant, they don't automatically get part of {panel.childName}'s `estate`.

elements.name: childDiedAfterNoGchildExistsFAQ3
elements.title: Do I include {panel.childName}'s children (biological or legally adopted) that were legally adopted by someone else?
elements.body:
The answer depends if {panel.childName} was alive when someone else legally adopted their children, and, if {panel.childName} gave up their parenting rights or not.

If {panel.childName} was alive at the time someone else legally adopted {panel.childName}'s children, and {panel.childName} gave up their parenting rights, {panel.childName}'s former children DO NOT need to be included.

If {panel.childName} had already died when {panel.childName}'s children were legally adopted by someone else, these children DO need to be included.

If {panel.childName} was alive when {panel.childName}'s children were legally adopted by someone else, but {panel.childName} did not give up their parenting rights, these children DO need to be included.

This last situation may happen if the children's other parent(s) gave up their parenting rights but {panel.childName} still kept their parenting rights.

If you are not sure if someone who has been adopted is still considered {panel.childName}'s child or not, it is safer for you to include this person. You want as much transparency in your application as possible in case the Court considers this person {panel.childName}'s child.

Even though you are telling this person you are applying for a `Representation Grant`, if they are not {panel.childName}'s child anymore, they don't automatically get part of {panel.childName}'s `estate`.

For more information, click here to read about who should be included as {panel.childName}'s children, if they were adopt, from the Adoption Act. (This link opens in a new tab)

elements.name: childDiedAfterNoGchildExistsFAQ4
elements.title: Do I need to include {panel.childName}'s children-in-law?
elements.body: No, you do not need to include {panel.childName}'s children-in-law (the `spouses` of {panel.childName}'s biological or legally adopted children).

elements.name: childDiedAfterNoGchildExistsNoExplanation
elements.title: Because {panel.childName} died before {deceasedDateOfDeathPlus4} and {panel.childName} did not have children, the people managing {panel.childName}'s belongings do not need to know that you are applying for a `Representation Grant` for {deceasedName}.

elements.name: childDiedAfterNoGchildExistsYesTempError
elements.title: For now, this service has only been developed for a limited number of situations. At this time, this service cannot help you apply for a `Representation Grant`.

elements.name: childDiedAfterYesExplanation
elements.title:
Because {panel.childName} has died after {deceasedDateOfDeathPlus4}, {panel.childName}'s `personal representative` needs to know that you are applying for a `Representation Grant` for {deceasedName}.

It is your responsibility to check with {panel.childName}'s family and friends to find out who is {panel.childName}'s personal representative.

If you find out that {panel.childName} does not have a personal representative, this service will help you tell that to The Court.

elements.name: childHasPersonalRep
elements.title: Do you know if {panel.childName} has a `personal representative`?
elements.description:
If {panel.childName}'s personal representative is not alive anymore, contact that person's personal representative to find out who is now representing {panel.childName}.

If someone is planning on becoming {panel.childName}'s personal representative but hasn't done so yet, it is safer for you to include them as {panel.childPersonName}'s personal representative.

choices.text: I know {panel.childName} does NOT have a personal representative
I don't know if {panel.childName} has a personal representative

elements.description: This name should be written using the Roman alphabet. English and French are examples of languages that use the Roman alphabet.

elements.name: childHasPersonalRepYesExplanation
elements.title:

This service will tell you how to let them know in a later step.

elements.name: childHasPersonalRepNoTempError
elements.title: For now, this service has only been developed for a limited number of situations. At this time, this service cannot help you apply for a `Representation Grant`.

elements.name: childHasPersonalRepDKExplanation
elements.title:
You are responsible for knowing for sure if {panel.childName} has a `personal representative`.

Because you are not sure if {panel.childName} has a personal representative, it is safer for you to check with as many of {panel.childName}'s family and friends as you can find.

You want as much transparency in your application as possible in case {panel.childName} does have a personal representative and The Court doesn't think you've given enough people a fair chance.

elements.title: What did {panel.childName}'s family or friends tell you about {panel.childName}'s `personal representative`?

they told me {panel.childName} does NOT have a personal representative

elements.name: childHasPersonalRepDKFamilyConfirmedYesExplanation
elements.title:

  • Do you know if {panel.childName} has a `personal representative`?
Change your answer to:
  • I know {panel.childName} has a personal representative

elements.name: childHasPersonalRepDKFamilyConfirmedNoExplanation
elements.title:
Scroll back up to the question:
  • Do you know if {panel.childName} has a `personal representative`?
Change your answer to:
  • I know {panel.childName} does NOT have a personal representative

elements.name: childHasPersonalRepDKFamilyConfirmedDKExplanation
elements.title:
If {panel.childName}'s family or friends do not know if {panel.childName} has a `personal representative`, you can hire professional investigators to try and find out for sure.

Examples of professional investigators include private investigators, heir tracers and other similar services.

You do not have to hire a professional investigator if you don't want to.

The reason you may want to hire a professional investigator is to show The Court that you did all you could to find {panel.childName}'s personal representative.

The Court will ultimately decide whether or not you have made enough of an effort to find {panel.childName}'s personal representative.

If you do hire a professional investigator, you will need to pay their fees yourself. If The Court gives you a `Representation Grant` for {deceasedName}, you will be able to get that money back from {deceasedName}'s `estate`.

elements.name: childHasPersonalRepDKHireInvestigator
elements.title: Do you want to hire a professional investigator to find out if {panel.childName} has a `personal representative`?

elements.name: childHasPersonalRepDKHireInvestigatorNoExplanation
elements.title:
You may be risking a delay to your application if {panel.childName}'s family or friends don't know for sure if {panel.childName} has a `personal representative` and you don't keep investigating.

If the Court does not think that you did all you could to find {panel.childName}'s personal representative, they may ask you to hire a professional investigator before they will give a `Representation Grant` for {deceasedName}.

If you don't want to hire a professional investigator right now, scroll back up to the question:
  • Do you know if {panel.childName} has a `personal representative`?
Change your answer to:
  • I know {panel.childName} does NOT have a personal representative
